Bolted Joints¶

Bolted joints module.

bolt module¶

Calculate the flexibility of a fastener in a lap joint.

class brokkr.bolted_joints.bolt.Bolt(dia, bolt_type, e, c=1)¶

Bases: object

A class representing a single fastner.

dia¶

shank diameter

Type

float

bolt_type¶

fastener type. Maybe either ‘rivet’ or ‘bolt’

Type

str

e¶

Young’s modulus

Type

float

c¶

flexibility

Type

float

k¶

stiffness

Type

float

boeing(t1, t2, e1, e2)¶

Calculate the flexibility using the Boeing method.

property c

Return the fastener flexibility based on the chosen method.

property flex_method¶

Return the fastener flexibility method.

grumman(t1, t2, e1, e2)¶

Calculate the flexibility using the Grumman method.

huth(t1, t2, e1, e2, mat1, mat2, lap_type='single')¶

Calculate the flexibility using the Huth/Airbus method.

property k

Return the fastener stiffness based on the flexibility method.

swift(t1, t2, e1, e2)¶

Calculate the bolt stiffness using the Swift/Douglas method.

tate(t1, t2, e1, e2, nu_b)¶

Calculate the flexibility using the Tate and Rosenfeld method.

vought(t1, t2)¶

Calculate the flexibility using the Vought method.

Note: only applies for aluminum sheets joined by steel fasteners

bolt_group module¶

fastener module¶

lap_joint module¶

Calculate the bearing load distribution on a lap joint

The lap joint is defined by a user-supplied *.csv file. The joint is assumed to belayed out like the diagram below.

Lap 2

2—–4—–6—–8—-> P2 | | | | B1 B2 B3 B4 | | | |

Pin <—-1—–3—–5—–7—-> P1

Lap 1

The bolts are shown as Bi, the nodes on the top lap are odd, and the nodes on the lower lap are even. The input load is Pin and the output loads are given by P1 for the bottom lap and P2 for the top lap.

Required modules:

  • math

  • csv

  • numpy

  • mechpy.bolt_flex

Inputs:

The *.csv should be organized by fastener

# TODO: cleanup table samples
fasteners

ID Thickness 1 Thickness 2 Modulus Pitch Diameter Bolt Type Nu 1 t11 t12 e1 pitch1 d1 type1 nu_b_1 2 t21 t22 e2 pitch2 d2 type2 nu_b_2 3 t31 t32 e3 pitch3 d3 type3 nu_b_3 4 t41 t42 e4 pitch4 d4 type4 nu_b_4

joint info

p_in input load p_out1 lap 1 output load p_out2 lap 2 output load width joint width e1 lap 1 modulus e2 lap 2 modulus mat1 lap 1 material type mat2 lap 2 material type nu1 lap 1 poisson’s ratio nu2 lap2 poisson’s ratio joint_type single or double shear

# TODO: add complete list of formulations
stiffness formulation

  • ‘Huth’

  • etc.

Assumptions:

  • For stepped joints, the step occurs halfway between the fasteners

loadset module¶

Load sets for bolted joint calculations.

class brokkr.bolted_joints.loadset.LoadSet(*loads)¶

Bases: object

A set of loads.

append(newLoad)¶

Add a new load to the load set.

clear()¶

Clear the load set of loads.

get_from_csv(fileName, clear=False)¶

Import applied loads from a CSV.

insert(key, newLoad)¶

Insert new load at specified index.

property sumLocation¶

Return __sumLocation attribute.

__sumLocation is kept private to ensure that, whenever it is changed, the set is updated and the total moment is accurate.

property totalForce¶

Return __totalForce.

property totalMoment¶

Return __totalMoment.
